business.headline: Afcons Infrastructure IPO Day 1: Check latest subscription, GMP Afcons Infrastructure's IPO aims to raise Rs 5,430 crore and consists of a fresh issue of 2.7 crore shares, totalling Rs 1,250 crore, and an offer for sale of 9.03 crore shares, amounting to Rs 4,180 crore.

IndusInd Bank share price dips 18% after Q2 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?In the second quarter, IndusInd Bank's net profit plunged 39% year-on-year to Rs 1,325 crore, falling significantly short of what the market had expected. In comparison, the profit stood at Rs 2,181.47 crore in the same quarter a year ago.

India-Canada tensions hit trade, leaving business owners in a bindTotal trade between both nations since 2021, was at roughly $6 billion, increased to $9 billion in 2022, but dropped to $8 billion in 2023 as per data from the consulate general of India on commerce.

Reliance, Nvidia partner to build large-scale AI infrastructure in IndiaThe partnership will see Reliance deploying Nvidia's latest GB 200 supercomputer technology to build a massive AI infrastructure.

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang aims for growth in India through new partnershipsIndia is seen as a key player in the AI market, with its population of 1.4 billion increasingly adopting AI across various sectors such as agriculture, education, and manufacturing.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Centre briefs parliamentary panel about Canada row, says issue 'sensitive': SourcesIn the meeting, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri shared some details about the diplomatic standoff between India and Canada. Misri also told the panel that since the issue is very sensitive, more details will be shared at a later time, sources said.

Rahul Gandhi upset with 'favouritism' in suggested candidate names: SourcesCongress leader Rahul Gandhi was upset over the names of probable candidates, suggested for the upcoming Assembly polls in Maharashtra.

Abhimanyu Easwaran, Nitish Reddy in India's jumbo squad for Australia TestsThe BCCI has announced a jumbo 18-member squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia. Abhimanyu Easwaran returned to the Test squad with Nitish Reddy and Harshit Rana earning a maiden call-up in the format.
Calcium, Vitamin D3 tablets among 49 drugs that fail quality testsThe drugs control panel also flagged four medicines which were manufactured by fake companies.
What eating raw vegetables does to your gutPlanning to enjoy a bowl of salad for your next meal? Raw vegetables are generally a healthier choice, but many people have concerns about hygiene.

AAP claims attack bid on Arvind Kejriwal by BJP-linked people, party deniesAAP leaders launched an attack against the BJP on Friday, alleging that people linked to the party attempted to attack Arvind Kejriwal. The Delhi BJP chief refuted the charges.

India Today impact: Sting op on fake ghee leads to raids in UP's HathrasAn India Today TV report revealed disturbing details about ghee sold in local markets in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras. The sting operation on adulteration in ghee led to the officials taking note of the issue, with raids being conducted on Friday.

Trump supporter Elon Musk in contact with Putin, claims report; Kremlin deniesThe Wall Street Journal report on Friday claimed that Elon Musk is in regular contact with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Gain hands-on experience through live sessions, capstone projects, and industry-relevant assignments, while accessing the prestigious IIMK Executive Alumni network.

Tamil Nadu BJP criticises Udhayanidhi over incorrect rendition of state songAfter the parts of the state song, Tamil Thai Vaazhthu, were sung incorrectly at an event attended by Tamil Nadu Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin, the state BJP leaders slammed the DMK minister.

IAS officer Tina Dabi greets BJP leader 5 times in 7 seconds. Video sparks debateIn the viral video, Tina Dabi is seen bowing her head five times in a row – all in seven seconds – with folded hands as she greeted BJP leader Satish Poonia.

Joe Biden apologises for Native American boarding schools, gets interruptedFrom 1819 through the 1970s, these boarding schools' purpose was to culturally assimilate Native Americans by forcibly removing them from their families, communities, religions and cultural beliefs.

Centre ropes in Meta, X to trace those threatening Indian flights, railwaysThe Aviation Ministry, along with the IT Ministry, is looking at all the threats, while the Railway Ministry is also very closely monitoring all the incidents involving objects and dangerous items being found on railway tracks across the country.

PM welcomes Germany's move to grant 90,000 skilled labour visas to IndiansPrime Minister Narendra Modi has welcomed Germany's move to significantly increase the annual cap on skilled labour visas and work permits for Indian professionals.

Give 5 seats or will contest on 25: Samajwadi leader's warning to MVA alliesAbu Asim Azmi, chief of Samajwadi Party's Maharashtra unit, gave a deadline to his MVA allies till Saturday afternoon to agree on his demand for five seats.

A physicist created the world's first-ever video gameAmerican physicist William Higinbotham's creation of Tennis for Two showed that even a physicist can serve up fun! His simple game developed in 1958 laid the foundation for the coruscating world of video gaming we enjoy today.

In Ratan Tata's will, share not just for siblings but dog Tito and butler tooIndustrialist-philanthropist Ratan Tata, whose estate is estimated to be around Rs 10,000 crore, has left behind a share not just for his siblings but also for his butler and German Shepherd Tito. In his will, Tata has waived loans given to his executive assistant Shantanu Naidu as well.
Not every nude painting is obscene: Court directs Customs to release artworksThe Bombay High Court in its observation pointed out that "sex and obscenity are not always synonymous".

Ariha Shah, 3, fostered in Germany since 2021, government says environment 'not natural'Ariha Shah has been under German state custody since September 2021 following allegations of abuse. The government has been working on her repatriation since then.

sports.headline: Ruturaj's only mistake is wearing yellow jersey: Fans upset with exclusionA certain section of fans was upset about Ruturaj Gaikwad's exclusion from both of India's T20I and Test squads against South Africa and Australia respectively. He last featured in the Indian team during the T20I series against Zimbabwe in July 2024.

Jemimah's father rubbishes claims of holding 'religious activities' at gymkhanaJemimah Rodrigues' father, Ivan, denied allegations of misusing her Khar Gymkhana membership for religious gatherings, clarifying that prayer meetings followed club protocols. Despite the controversy, the Gymkhana acknowledged Jemimah's cricketing achievements and wished her continued success in her career.

Ramandeep and Vijaykumar Vyshak earn maiden India call-ups for SA T20IsRamandeep Singh and Vijaykumar Vyshak, IPL 2024 breakout stars, earned maiden call-ups for India's T20I squad against South Africa. Their performances provide fresh promise as India navigates key injuries ahead of the four-match series starting November 8.

Nitish Reddy and Harshit Rana earn maiden Test call-ups for Australia seriesNitish Reddy and Harshit Rana earned their maiden Test call-up following their exploits in the white ball format. The BCCI announced an 18-member squad for the upcoming Border Gavaskar Trophy series.

India A knocked out of Emerging Asia Cup by a fiery Afghanistan AIndia A's journey in the Emerging Asia Cup ended with a 20-run semi-final defeat to Afghanistan A, as Tilak Varma's side fell short of a 207-run target in Al Amerat, despite a determined last push from Ramandeep Singh.

England were reeling at 24 for 3, still trailing Pakistan by 53 runs at Stumps on Day 2.

Watch: Virat Kohli yells at fielders after Rohit spills a tough catch in PuneVirat Kohli was visibly furious at the Indian fielders as they failed to save a boundary after a tough catch spilt out of Rohit Sharma's hands. New Zealand have a hefty lead by 301 runs at Day 2 stumps in Pune.

MS Dhoni will be the first retention pick for CSK: Harbhajan Singh opinesHarbhajan Singh urged Chennai Super Kings to prioritize retaining MS Dhoni for IPL 2025, pending Dhoni's decision. With Dhoni qualifying as an "uncapped" player under new rules, CSK could secure the icon at a reduced cost.

Indian batters lack defensive technique to survive against spin: Saba KarimFormer India wicketkeeper batter Saba Karim has mentioned that Indian batters' lack good defensive technique to survive against spinners.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
